meanings.definition: rakees (verb): to gather or collect with a rake
meanings.sent1: She rakees the fallen leaves into a neat pile.
meanings.sent2: Every autumn, he rakees the yard to keep it tidy.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel decided to rakees all the acorns into a secret stash.
meanings.sent4: The farmer rakees the hay with precision, like an artist creating a masterpiece.
meanings.sent5: The children's laughter filled the air as they rakees colorful autumn leaves together.

meanings.definition: rakees (noun): a person who uses a rake
meanings.sent1: The rakees worked hard to clear the garden of debris.
meanings.sent2: The diligent rakees kept the park clean and beautiful.
meanings.sent3: The rakees joked about starting a rake-wielding superhero team.
meanings.sent4: She was a true rakees, always ready to tackle any yard work challenge.
meanings.sent5: The rakees's hands were calloused from hours of raking leaves.

meanings.definition: rakees (adjective): relating to or characteristic of rakes
meanings.sent1: The rakees handle made the tool easy to grip.
meanings.sent2: The rakees design of the garden tool ensured efficient leaf collection.
meanings.sent3: The rakees pattern on the fence added a charming touch to the backyard.
meanings.sent4: Her rakees skills in gardening were admired by all her neighbors.
meanings.sent5: The rakees sound of the metal rake against the pavement echoed through the garden.
